senses.sense_definition: The canopy under which a Jewish couple stands during their marriage ceremony.

examples.text: The bride and groom stood happily under the <w>chuppah</w> while the rabbi spoke.
Family members held the poles of the <w>chuppah</w> to support the beautiful cloth canopy.

senses.sense_definition: A Jewish marriage ceremony or wedding.

examples.text: We received an invitation to attend the <w>chuppah</w> at the local synagogue next week.
The <w>chuppah</w> was followed by a lively reception with music and dancing.
